segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 36
2. Rahogatavagga
17. Paṭhamasambahulasutta
Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “katamā nu kho, bhante, vedanā, katamo vedanāsamudayo, katamo vedanānirodho, katamā vedanānirodhagāminī paṭipadā?
segments.en: “Sir, what is feeling? What’s the origin of feeling? What’s the cessation of feeling? What’s the practice that leads to the cessation of feeling?

segments.pli: Ko vedanāya assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṃ nissaraṇan”ti?
segments.en: And what is feeling’s gratification, drawback, and escape?”

segments.pli: “Tisso imā, bhikkhave, vedanā—
sukhā vedanā, dukkhā vedanā, adukkhamasukhā vedanā—
imā vuccanti, bhikkhave, vedanā.
Phassasamudayā vedanāsamudayo;
phassanirodhā vedanānirodho.
Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo vedanānirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: The practice that leads to the cessation of feelings is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

segments.pli: sammādiṭṭhi … pe … sammāsamādhi.
segments.en: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Yaṃ vedanaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, ayaṃ vedanāya assādo.
segments.en: The pleasure and happiness that arise from feeling: this is its gratification.

segments.pli: Yaṃ vedanā aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā, ayaṃ vedanāya ādīnavo.
segments.en: That feeling is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.

segments.pli: Yo vedanāya chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṃ, idaṃ vedanāya nissaraṇaṃ.
segments.en: Removing and giving up desire and greed for feeling: this is its escape.

segments.pli: Atha kho pana, bhikkhave, mayā anupubbasaṅkhārānaṃ nirodho akkhāto.
segments.en: But I have also explained the progressive cessation of conditions. …

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vācā niruddhā hoti … pe …
khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno rāgo niruddho hoti, doso niruddho hoti, moho niruddho hoti.
Atha kho pana, bhikkhave, mayā anupubbasaṅkhārānaṃ vūpasamo akkhāto.
Paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vācā vūpasantā hoti … pe …
khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno rāgo vūpasanto hoti, doso vūpasanto hoti, moho vūpasanto hoti.
Chayimā, bhikkhave, passaddhiyo.
Paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vācā paṭippassaddhā hoti.
Dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa vitakkavicārā paṭippassaddhā honti.
Tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa pīti paṭippassaddhā hoti.
Catutthaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannassa assāsapassāsā paṭippassaddhā honti.
Saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpannassa saññā ca vedanā ca paṭippassaddhā honti.
Khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno rāgo paṭippassaddho hoti, doso paṭippassaddho hoti, moho paṭippassaddho hotī”ti.
segments.en: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have been tranquilized.”

segments.pli: Sattamaṃ.
